group.name: Administration Tools
group.description: This group is a collection of graphical administration tools for the system, such as for managing user accounts and configuring system hardware.

group.name: Authoring and Publishing
group.description: These tools allow you to create documentation in the DocBook format and convert them to HTML, PDF, Postscript, and text.

group.name: Base
group.description: This group includes a minimal set of packages. Useful for creating small router/firewall boxes, for example.

group.name: Conflicts
group.description: This group includes packages conflicting with @everything installation.

group.name: Core
group.description: Smallest possible installation

group.name: Clustering
group.description: Clustering Support.

group.name: Cluster Storage
group.description: Packages which provide support for cluster storage.

group.name: DNS Name Server
group.description: This package group allows you to run a DNS name server (BIND) on the system.

group.name: Development Libraries
group.description: The packages in this group are core libraries needed to develop applications.

group.name: OpenFabrics Enterprise Distribution
group.description: Components used for high performance networking and clustering, such as Infiniband and RDMA.

group.name: Development Tools
group.description: These tools include core development tools such as automake, gcc, perl, python, and debuggers.

group.name: Editors
group.description: Sometimes called text editors, these are programs that allow you to create and edit files. These include Emacs and Vi.

group.name: Emacs
group.description: The GNU Emacs text editor.

group.name: Engineering and Scientific
group.description: This group includes packages for performing mathematical and scientific computations and plotting, as well as unit conversion.

group.name: FTP Server
group.description: These tools allow you to run an FTP server on the system.

group.name: GNOME Desktop Environment
group.description: GNOME is a powerful, graphical user interface which includes a panel, desktop, system icons, and a graphical file manager.

group.name: GNOME Software Development
group.description: Install these packages in order to develop GTK+ and GNOME graphical applications.

group.name: Games and Entertainment
group.description: Various ways to relax and spend your free time.

group.name: Graphical Internet
group.description: This group includes graphical email, Web, and chat clients.

group.name: Graphics
group.description: This group includes packages to help you manipulate and scan images.

group.name: Java
group.description: Support for running programs written in the Java programming language.

group.name: Java Development
group.description: Support for developing programs in the Java programming language.

group.name: KDE (K Desktop Environment)
group.description: KDE is a powerful, graphical user interface which includes a panel, desktop, system icons, and a graphical file manager.

group.name: KDE Software Development
group.description: Install these packages to develop QT and KDE graphical applications.

group.name: Legacy Network Server
group.description: These packages include servers for old network protocols such as rsh and telnet.

group.name: Legacy Software Development
group.description: These packages provide compatibility support with previous releases.

group.name: Mail Server
group.description: These packages allow you to configure an IMAP or SMTP mail server.

group.name: MySQL Database
group.description: This package group contains packages useful for use with MySQL.

group.name: Network Servers
group.description: These packages include network-based servers such as DHCP, Kerberos and NIS.

group.name: News Server
group.description: This group allows you to configure the system as a news server.

group.name: Office/Productivity
group.description: The applications include office suites, PDF viewers, and more.

group.name: PostgreSQL Database
group.description: This package group includes packages useful for use with Postgresql.

group.name: Printing Support
group.description: Install these tools to enable the system to print or act as a print server.

group.name: Ruby
group.description: Basic support for the Ruby programming language.

group.name: Server Configuration Tools
group.description: This group contains all of CentOS's custom server configuration tools.

group.name: Sound and Video
group.description: From CD recording to playing audio CDs and multimedia files, this package group allows you to work with sound and video on the system.

group.name: System Tools
group.description: This group is a collection of various tools for the system, such as the client for connecting to SMB shares and tools to monitor network traffic.

group.name: Text-based Internet
group.description: This group includes text-based email, Web, and chat clients. These applications do not require the X Window System.

group.name: Web Server
group.description: These tools allow you to run a Web server on the system.

group.name: Windows File Server
group.description: This package group allows you to share files between Linux and MS Windows(tm) systems.

group.name: X Software Development
group.description: These packages allow you to develop applications for the X Window System.

group.name: X Window System
group.description: Install this group of packages to use the base graphical (X) user interface.

group.name: Virtualization
group.description: Virtualization Support.

group.name: KVM
group.description: Virtualization Support with KVM

group.name: Clustering
group.description: Clustering Support.

group.name: Cluster Storage
group.description: Packages which provide support for cluster storage.

category.name: Languages
category.description: These packages provide support for various locales including fonts and input methods.

category.name: Base System
category.description: Various core pieces of the system.

category.name: Applications
category.description: Applications for a variety of tasks

category.name: Servers
category.description: Software used for running network servers

category.name: Development
category.description: Packages which provide functionality for developing and building applications.

category.name: Cluster Storage
category.description: Packages which provide support for cluster storage.
